newsitem.title: USA: Pennzoil to study acquisition offer.
newsitem.headline: Pennzoil to study acquisition offer.

text.p: Pennzoil Co said Monday its directors will review the unsolicited tender offer from Union Pacific Resources Group Inc.

Early Monday, Union Pacific proposed acquiring Pennzoil in a two-step transaction. The first step was a tender offer for $84 per share to acquire 50.1 percent of Pennzoil stock, to be financed by bank borrowings.
The second step includes a tax-free exchange of shares for the remaining 49.9 percent of Pennzoil.
The total value of the deal is put at about $6.4 billion.
Pennzoil said it will publicly announce a response to the tender offer in two weeks -- by Monday, July 7.
In the meantime, the company said, it urges all its stockholders to defer any action on the offer until the board responds. ((-- New York Newsdesk 212 859-1610))
